result.execSummary: Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Lee Schuetz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: suspending proceedings

Michael Lee Schuetz, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Guy Mason Taylor.
Jeffrey Duane Kohl appeared as prosecuting attorney. State has complied with victim witness notification. It is stipulated that the defendant is not competent, and not likely to regain competence, therefore it is moved that the case be suspended indefinitely. Motion granted. Order suspending proceedings to be filed at a later date.
Addendum to Psychiatric Evaluation

Michael Lee Schuetz, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Guy Mason Taylor.
Craig Nolen appeared as prosecuting attorney. Defendant deemed incompetent. Outpatient commitment requested. Atty Nolen to prepare petition.  Status conference scheduled for December 21, 2016 at 03:45 pm.

Michael Lee Schuetz, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Jane Ellen Bucher.
Craig Nolen appeared as prosecuting attorney. Defense provides psychological evaluation to the court and the DA stipulates that Defendant is incompetant based on the report findings. As such atty nolen recommends that Defendant be remanded to the department of Human services for the purpose of regaining competency. Atty Bucher requests brief continuance. Competency report returned to the Defense to be returned on the next court date.  Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2016 at 10:45 am.

of Competancy Report

Michael Lee Schuetz, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Jane Ellen Bucher.
Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney. Defence is is seeking for court to make examination to determine Defendant's competence to assist. State does not have any objections. Asks to examine the defendant on an outpatient basis. Clerk to distribute the necessary documents. Court orders cash bond returned to the payor, and signature bond continues until next appearance.  Competency hearing scheduled for November 8, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Michael Lee Schuetz, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Guy Mason Taylor.
Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney.  Defendant given complaint.  Court advises defendant of rights.  Court advises defendant of charges and penalties.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Defendant stands mute, Court enters not guilty plea on defendants behalf.
